  • Chinese

🛍️ Week 5: Shopping & Making Purchases

day 29

  1. 购物 (gòuwù)
    • pinyin: gòuwù
    • definition: shopping; to shop
    • usage: the activity of buying goods from shops.
    • example: 我周末喜欢去购物中心购物。(wǒ zhōumò xǐhuān qù gòuwù zhōngxīn gòuwù.) - i like to go shopping at the mall on weekends.
    • contexts: leisure, errands, commerce.
  2. 商店 (shāngdiàn)
    • pinyin: shāngdiàn
    • definition: shop; store
    • usage: a building or part of a building where goods or services are sold.
    • example: 这条街上有很多小商店。(zhè tiáo jiē shàng yǒu hěnduō xiǎo shāngdiàn.) - there are many small shops on this street.
    • contexts: commerce, daily life, urban environment.
  3. 商场 (shāngchǎng)
    • pinyin: shāngchǎng
    • definition: shopping mall; department store
    • usage: a large enclosed shopping area from which traffic is excluded; a large store stocking a wide variety of goods in different departments.
    • example: 这家商场正在打折促销。(zhè jiā shāngchǎng zhèngzài dǎzhé cùxiāo.) - this shopping mall is having a discount promotion.
    • contexts: shopping, retail, leisure.
  4. 超市 (chāoshì)
    • pinyin: chāoshì
    • definition: supermarket
    • usage: a large self-service store selling groceries and household goods.
    • example: 我要去超市买些牛奶和面包。(wǒ yào qù chāoshì mǎi xiē niúnǎi hé miànbāo.) - i need to go to the supermarket to buy some milk and bread.
    • contexts: grocery shopping, daily errands.
  5. 市场 (shìchǎng)
    • pinyin: shìchǎng
    • definition: market (place)
    • usage: a regular gathering of people for the purchase and sale of provisions, livestock, and other commodities.
    • example: 菜市场的水果很新鲜。(cài shìchǎng de shuǐguǒ hěn xīnxiān.) - the fruits at the wet market are very fresh.
    • contexts: shopping (especially for fresh produce), local culture, commerce.
  6. 网上购物 (wǎngshàng gòuwù)
    • pinyin: wǎngshàng gòuwù
    • definition: online shopping
    • usage: the action or activity of buying goods or services over the internet.
    • example: 网上购物越来越流行了。(wǎngshàng gòuwù yuèláiyuè liúxíng le.) - online shopping is becoming increasingly popular.
    • contexts: e-commerce, internet, modern lifestyle.
  7. 淘宝 (táobǎo)
    • pinyin: táobǎo
    • definition: taobao (popular chinese online shopping website)
    • usage: refers specifically to the taobao e-commerce platform, but can sometimes be used more generally to mean online shopping in china.
    • example: 我经常在淘宝上买东西。(wǒ jīngcháng zài táobǎo shàng mǎi dōngxi.) - i often buy things on taobao.
    • contexts: online shopping, e-commerce in china.
  8. 购物车 (gòuwùchē)
    • pinyin: gòuwùchē
    • definition: shopping cart (physical or online)
    • usage: a cart supplied by a store for use by customers for carrying merchandise to the checkout counter; an icon on an e-commerce website representing a virtual cart for items a user intends to purchase.
    • example: 我的购物车里已经有很多东西了。(wǒ de gòuwùchē lǐ yǐjīng yǒu hěnduō dōngxi le.) - my shopping cart is already full of things.
    • contexts: shopping (in-store or online), e-commerce.
  9. 试穿 (shìchuān)
    • pinyin: shìchuān
    • definition: to try on (clothes, shoes)
    • usage: to put on an article of clothing to see if it fits or is suitable.
    • example: 我可以试穿这件衬衫吗？(wǒ kěyǐ shìchuān zhè jiàn chènshān ma?) - may i try on this shirt?
    • contexts: clothes shopping, fitting rooms.
  10. 试衣间 (shìyījiān)
    • pinyin: shìyījiān
    • definition: fitting room; dressing room
    • usage: a room in a shop where you can try on clothes before you buy them.
    • example: 试衣间在那边。(shìyījiān zài nàbiān.) - the fitting room is over there.
    • contexts: clothes shopping.

day 30

  1. 多少钱 (duōshao qián)
    • pinyin: duōshao qián
    • definition: how much money?; what’s the price?
    • usage: used to ask about the cost of an item.
    • example: 请问这个多少钱？(qǐngwèn zhège duōshao qián?) - excuse me, how much is this?
    • contexts: shopping, asking for prices.
  2. 价格 (jiàgé)
    • pinyin: jiàgé
    • definition: price
    • usage: the amount of money expected, required, or given in payment for something.
    • example: 这个价格太贵了。(zhège jiàgé tài guì le.) - this price is too expensive.
    • contexts: shopping, commerce, economics.
  3. 贵 (guì)
    • pinyin: guì
    • definition: expensive; valuable
    • usage: costing a lot of money.
    • example: 能不能便宜一点？太贵了。(néng bù néng piányi yīdiǎn? tài guì le.) - can it be a bit cheaper? it’s too expensive.
    • contexts: shopping, bargaining.
  4. 便宜 (piányi)
    • pinyin: piányi
    • definition: cheap; inexpensive
    • usage: low in price; worth more than its cost.
    • example: 这件衣服很便宜。(zhè jiàn yīfu hěn piányi.) - these clothes are very cheap.
    • contexts: shopping, bargaining.
  5. 打折 (dǎzhé)
    • pinyin: dǎzhé
    • definition: to give a discount; discount
    • usage: a reduction made from the gross amount or value of something.
    • example: 现在买这件商品可以打八折。(xiànzài mǎi zhè jiàn shāngpǐn kěyǐ dǎ bā zhé.) - you can get a 20% discount if you buy this product now (打八折 means 80% of the original price, i.e., 20% off).
    • contexts: shopping, promotions, sales.
  6. 讲价 (jiǎngjià)
    • pinyin: jiǎngjià
    • definition: to bargain; to haggle
    • usage: to discuss the price of something in an attempt to reduce it.
    • example: 在一些小市场可以讲价。(zài yīxiē xiǎo shìchǎng kěyǐ jiǎngjià.) - you can bargain in some small markets.
    • contexts: shopping (especially in markets), negotiation.
  7. 付款 (fùkuǎn)
    • pinyin: fùkuǎn
    • definition: to pay (money)
    • usage: to give money in return for goods or services.
    • example: 您想用什么方式付款？(nín xiǎng yòng shénme fāngshì fùkuǎn?) - how would you like to pay?
    • contexts: shopping, transactions, banking.
  8. 现金 (xiànjīn)
    • pinyin: xiànjīn
    • definition: cash
    • usage: money in coins or notes, as distinct from checks, money orders, or credit.
    • example: 我可以用现金支付吗？(wǒ kěyǐ yòng xiànjīn zhīfù ma?) - can i pay in cash?
    • contexts: payment methods, finance.
  9. 信用卡 (xìnyòngkǎ)
    • pinyin: xìnyòngkǎ
    • definition: credit card
    • usage: a small plastic card issued by a bank, building society, etc., allowing the holder to purchase goods or services on credit.
    • example: 我忘了带信用卡。(wǒ wàng le dài xìnyòngkǎ.) - i forgot to bring my credit card.
    • contexts: payment methods, finance, banking.
  10. 支付宝 (zhīfùbǎo)
    • pinyin: zhīfùbǎo
    • definition: alipay (popular chinese mobile payment platform)
    • usage: a widely used mobile and online payment platform in china.
    • example: 你可以用支付宝付款。(nǐ kěyǐ yòng zhīfùbǎo fùkuǎn.) - you can pay with alipay.
    • contexts: mobile payment, e-commerce in china, technology.

day 31

  1. 微信支付 (wēixìn zhīfù)
    • pinyin: wēixìn zhīfù
    • definition: wechat pay (popular chinese mobile payment platform)
    • usage: a mobile payment service integrated into the wechat app, widely used in china.
    • example: 很多商店都支持微信支付。(hěnduō shāngdiàn dōu zhīchí wēixìn zhīfù.) - many shops support wechat pay.
    • contexts: mobile payment, e-commerce in china, technology.
  2. 收银台 (shōuyíntái)
    • pinyin: shōuyíntái
    • definition: cashier; checkout counter
    • usage: the place in a store where payment is made for goods purchased.
    • example: 请到收银台付款。(qǐng dào shōuyíntái fùkuǎn.) - please pay at the cashier.
    • contexts: shopping, retail stores.
  3. 小票 (xiǎopiào)
    • pinyin: xiǎopiào
    • definition: receipt (from a purchase, small slip of paper)
    • usage: a small piece of paper confirming that one has paid for or received goods or services.
    • example: 请您收好小票。(qǐng nín shōuhǎo xiǎopiào.) - please keep your receipt carefully.
    • contexts: shopping, proof of purchase, returns.
  4. 发票 (fāpiào)
    • pinyin: fāpiào
    • definition: invoice; official receipt (for reimbursement or tax purposes)
    • usage: an official document issued by a seller to a buyer relating to a sale transaction and indicating the products, quantities, and agreed prices for products or services the seller had provided the buyer. used for accounting and reimbursement.
    • example: 我需要一张发票报销。(wǒ xūyào yī zhāng fāpiào bàoxiāo.) - i need an official receipt for reimbursement.
    • contexts: business expenses, accounting, formal transactions.
  5. 退货 (tuìhuò)
    • pinyin: tuìhuò
    • definition: to return merchandise; returned goods
    • usage: to give back an item bought to the seller, usually for a refund or exchange.
    • example: 如果不合适，可以在七天内退货。(rúguǒ bù héshì, kěyǐ zài qī tiān nèi tuìhuò.) - if it’s not suitable, you can return it within seven days.
    • contexts: shopping, customer service, consumer rights.
  6. 换货 (huànhuò)
    • pinyin: huànhuò
    • definition: to exchange merchandise
    • usage: to give back an item bought and receive another item in its place.
    • example: 我想把这件衣服换个大号的。(wǒ xiǎng bǎ zhè jiàn yīfu huàn gè dà hào de.) - i want to exchange this piece of clothing for a larger size.
    • contexts: shopping, customer service.
  7. 质量 (zhìliàng)
    • pinyin: zhìliàng
    • definition: quality (of goods)
    • usage: the standard of something as measured against other things of a similar kind; the degree of excellence of something.
    • example: 这件商品的质量很好。(zhè jiàn shāngpǐn de zhìliàng hěn hǎo.) - the quality of this product is very good.
    • contexts: shopping, manufacturing, product reviews.
  8. 品牌 (pǐnpái)
    • pinyin: pǐnpái
    • definition: brand; trademark
    • usage: a type of product manufactured by a particular company under a particular name.
    • example: 你喜欢哪个品牌的手机？(nǐ xǐhuān nǎge pǐnpái de shǒujī?) - which brand of mobile phone do you like?
    • contexts: shopping, marketing, consumer goods.
  9. 新款 (xīnkuǎn)
    • pinyin: xīnkuǎn
    • definition: new style; latest model
    • usage: a new design or version of a product.
    • example: 这是我们店里最新款的连衣裙。(zhè shì wǒmen diàn lǐ zuì xīnkuǎn de liányīqún.) - this is the newest style of dress in our store.
    • contexts: fashion, technology, shopping.
  10. 促销 (cùxiāo)
    • pinyin: cùxiāo
    • definition: sales promotion; to promote sales
    • usage: activity that supports or provides active encouragement for the furtherance of a cause, venture, or aim, especially the sale of a product.
    • example: 商场正在进行年底大促销。(shāngchǎng zhèngzài jìnxíng niándǐ dà cùxiāo.) - the mall is having a big year-end sales promotion.
    • contexts: marketing, retail, shopping.

day 32

  1. 会员 (huìyuán)
    • pinyin: huìyuán
    • definition: member (of a club, store, etc.)
    • usage: a person who has joined a group, organization, or club.
    • example: 如果你是会员，可以享受折扣。(rúguǒ nǐ shì huìyuán, kěyǐ xiǎngshòu zhékòu.) - if you are a member, you can enjoy a discount.
    • contexts: shopping, clubs, loyalty programs.
  2. 积分 (jīfēn)
    • pinyin: jīfēn
    • definition: points (in a loyalty program); to accumulate points
    • usage: units awarded to customers in a loyalty program, which can be redeemed for rewards.
    • example: 消费可以累积积分。(xiāofèi kěyǐ lěijī jīfēn.) - spending can accumulate points.
    • contexts: loyalty programs, shopping, rewards.
  3. 优惠券 (yōuhuìquàn)
    • pinyin: yōuhuìquàn
    • definition: coupon
    • usage: a voucher entitling the holder to a discount for a particular product.
    • example: 我有一张满减优惠券。(wǒ yǒu yī zhāng mǎnjiǎn yōuhuìquàn.) - i have a coupon for a discount upon reaching a certain spending amount.
    • contexts: shopping, discounts, promotions.
  4. 礼品卡 (lǐpǐnkǎ)
    • pinyin: lǐpǐnkǎ
    • definition: gift card
    • usage: a prepaid stored-value money card, usually issued by a retailer or bank, to be used as an alternative to cash for purchases within a particular store or related businesses.
    • example: 我收到了一张书店的礼品卡。(wǒ shōudào le yī zhāng shūdiàn de lǐpǐnkǎ.) - i received a gift card for a bookstore.
    • contexts: gifts, shopping, retail.
  5. 包邮 (bāoyóu)
    • pinyin: bāoyóu
    • definition: free shipping; shipping included
    • usage: indicates that the seller will cover the cost of shipping.
    • example: 满一百元包邮。(mǎn yī bǎi yuán bāoyóu.) - free shipping for purchases over 100 yuan.
    • contexts: online shopping, e-commerce, delivery.
  6. 快递 (kuàidì)
    • pinyin: kuàidì
    • definition: express delivery; courier service
    • usage: a service for transporting parcels and documents quickly.
    • example: 我的快递什么时候能到？(wǒ de kuàidì shénme shíhou néng dào?) - when will my express delivery arrive?
    • contexts: online shopping, logistics, shipping.
  7. 送货上门 (sònghuò shàngmén)
    • pinyin: sònghuò shàngmén
    • definition: home delivery; to deliver to one’s door
    • usage: the service of bringing goods to a customer’s home.
    • example: 这家超市提供送货上门服务。(zhè jiā chāoshì tígōng sònghuò shàngmén fúwù.) - this supermarket offers home delivery service.
    • contexts: shopping, delivery services, convenience.
  8. 评价 (píngjià)
    • pinyin: píngjià
    • definition: review; evaluation; to evaluate; to review
    • usage: an assessment or opinion of something or someone, formed after consideration.
    • example: 我在网上看了很多关于这个产品的评价。(wǒ zài wǎngshàng kàn le hěnduō guānyú zhège chǎnpǐn de píngjià.) - i read many online reviews about this product.
    • contexts: online shopping, product feedback, customer service.
  9. 好评 (hǎopíng)
    • pinyin: hǎopíng
    • definition: positive review; good feedback
    • usage: favorable assessment or opinion.
    • example: 这个商品收到了很多好评。(zhège shāngpǐn shōudào le hěnduō hǎopíng.) - this product has received many positive reviews.
    • contexts: online shopping, customer satisfaction.
  10. 差评 (chàpíng)
    • pinyin: chàpíng
    • definition: negative review; bad feedback
    • usage: unfavorable assessment or opinion.
    • example: 如果产品有问题，顾客可能会给差评。(rúguǒ chǎnpǐn yǒu wèntí, gùkè kěnéng huì gěi chàpíng.) - if there is a problem with the product, customers might leave a negative review.
    • contexts: online shopping, customer dissatisfaction.

day 33

  1. 正品 (zhèngpǐn)
    • pinyin: zhèngpǐn
    • definition: genuine product; authentic goods (not counterfeit)
    • usage: an item that is not a copy or imitation.
    • example: 这家店保证所有商品都是正品。(zhè jiā diàn bǎozhèng suǒyǒu shāngpǐn dōu shì zhèngpǐn.) - this store guarantees that all its products are genuine.
    • contexts: shopping, consumer rights, brand protection.
  2. 假货 (jiǎhuò)
    • pinyin: jiǎhuò
    • definition: counterfeit goods; fake product
    • usage: an imitation of a genuine product, made with the intention to deceive.
    • example: 要小心，不要买到假货。(yào xiǎoxīn, bùyào mǎidào jiǎhuò.) - be careful not to buy counterfeit goods.
    • contexts: shopping, consumer protection, legal issues.
  3. 二手 (èrshǒu)
    • pinyin: èrshǒu
    • definition: second-hand; used
    • usage: having had a previous owner; not new.
    • example: 我在二手市场买了一辆自行车。(wǒ zài èrshǒu shìchǎng mǎi le yī liàng zìxíngchē.) - i bought a second-hand bicycle at the flea market.
    • contexts: shopping, sustainability, budget.
  4. 奢侈品 (shēchǐpǐn)
    • pinyin: shēchǐpǐn
    • definition: luxury goods; luxury items
    • usage: expensive items that are not essential but are highly desired and associated with wealth or status.
    • example: 他喜欢购买各种奢侈品。(tā xǐhuān gòumǎi gèzhǒng shēchǐpǐn.) - he likes to buy various luxury goods.
    • contexts: high-end shopping, fashion, lifestyle, status symbols.
  5. 日用品 (rìyòngpǐn)
    • pinyin: rìyòngpǐn
    • definition: daily necessities; articles for everyday use
    • usage: common items used in daily life, such as toiletries, cleaning supplies, etc.
    • example: 我要去超市买些日用品。(wǒ yào qù chāoshì mǎi xiē rìyòngpǐn.) - i need to go to the supermarket to buy some daily necessities.
    • contexts: grocery shopping, household management.
  6. 服装 (fúzhuāng)
    • pinyin: fúzhuāng
    • definition: clothing; apparel; garments
    • usage: items worn on the body.
    • example: 这家店主要卖女式服装。(zhè jiā diàn zhǔyào mài nǚshì fúzhuāng.) - this store mainly sells women’s clothing.
    • contexts: fashion, shopping, personal style.
  7. 鞋子 (xiézi)
    • pinyin: xiézi
    • definition: shoes
    • usage: outer coverings for the human foot, typically made of leather or canvas.
    • example: 我想买一双新鞋子。(wǒ xiǎng mǎi yī shuāng xīn xiézi.) - i want to buy a new pair of shoes.
    • contexts: shopping, fashion, footwear.
  8. 包 (bāo)
    • pinyin: bāo
    • definition: bag; sack; package; bundle
    • usage: a container made of paper, plastic, or cloth, typically used for carrying things.
    • example: 这个包很漂亮。(zhège bāo hěn piàoliang.) - this bag is very beautiful.
    • contexts: shopping, fashion accessories, daily use.
  9. 化妆品 (huàzhuāngpǐn)
    • pinyin: huàzhuāngpǐn
    • definition: cosmetics; makeup
    • usage: substances used to enhance or alter the appearance or fragrance of the body.
    • example: 她买了很多进口化妆品。(tā mǎi le hěnduō jìnkǒu huàzhuāngpǐn.) - she bought a lot of imported cosmetics.
    • contexts: beauty, shopping, personal care.
  10. 护肤品 (hùfūpǐn)
    • pinyin: hùfūpǐn
    • definition: skincare products
    • usage: products used to care for the skin.
    • example: 选择适合自己肤质的护肤品很重要。(xuǎnzé shìhé zìjǐ fūzhì de hùfūpǐn hěn zhòngyào.) - it is important to choose skincare products suitable for your skin type.
    • contexts: beauty, personal care, health.

day 34

  1. 电器 (diànqì)
    • pinyin: diànqì
    • definition: electrical appliance; electronics
    • usage: a device or piece of equipment designed to perform a specific task, typically a domestic or household one, and powered by electricity.
    • example: 我们家需要买一台新冰箱，旧的电器坏了。(wǒmen jiā xūyào mǎi yī tái xīn bīngxiāng, jiù de diànqì huài le.) - our family needs to buy a new refrigerator, the old appliance is broken.
    • contexts: household goods, shopping, technology.
  2. 家具 (jiājù)
    • pinyin: jiājù
    • definition: furniture
    • usage: large movable equipment, such as tables and chairs, used to make a house, office, or other space suitable for living or working.
    • example: 我们正在为新家挑选家具。(wǒmen zhèngzài wèi xīnjiā tiāoxuǎn jiājù.) - we are choosing furniture for our new home.
    • contexts: home decor, shopping, interior design.
  3. 文具 (wénjù)
    • pinyin: wénjù
    • definition: stationery; writing materials
    • usage: commercially manufactured writing materials, including cut paper, envelopes, writing implements, and other office supplies.
    • example: 开学前要去买些文具。(kāixué qián yào qù mǎi xiē wénjù.) - i need to buy some stationery before school starts.
    • contexts: school supplies, office supplies, shopping.
  4. 玩具 (wánjù)
    • pinyin: wánjù
    • definition: toy
    • usage: an object for a child to play with.
    • example: 孩子们喜欢新玩具。(háizimen xǐhuān xīn wánjù.) - children like new toys.
    • contexts: children, gifts, shopping, play.
  5. 食品 (shípǐn)
    • pinyin: shípǐn
    • definition: food; foodstuffs
    • usage: any nutritious substance that people or animals eat or drink, or that plants absorb, in order to maintain life and growth.
    • example: 请注意食品的保质期。(qǐng zhùyì shípǐn de bǎozhìqī.) - please pay attention to the expiration date of the food.
    • contexts: grocery shopping, health, cooking.
  6. 保质期 (bǎozhìqī)
    • pinyin: bǎozhìqī
    • definition: expiration date (for food, medicine); shelf life
    • usage: the length of time for which an item remains usable, fit for consumption, or saleable.
    • example: 这个牛奶快过保质期了。(zhège niúnǎi kuài guò bǎozhìqī le.) - this milk is about to expire.
    • contexts: food safety, shopping, medicine.
  7. 生产日期 (shēngchǎn rìqī)
    • pinyin: shēngchǎn rìqī
    • definition: production date; manufacturing date
    • usage: the date on which a product was manufactured.
    • example: 购买食品时要注意查看生产日期和保质期。(gòumǎi shípǐn shí yào zhùyì chákàn shēngchǎn rìqī hé bǎozhìqī.) - when buying food, pay attention to the production date and expiration date.
    • contexts: food safety, shopping, manufacturing.
  8. 缺货 (quēhuò)
    • pinyin: quēhuò
    • definition: out of stock; shortage of goods
    • usage: (of goods) temporarily unavailable for sale.
    • example: 对不起，您要的那个型号暂时缺货。(duìbuqǐ, nín yào de nàge xínghào zànshí quēhuò.) - sorry, the model you want is temporarily out of stock.
    • contexts: shopping, retail, inventory.
  9. 有货 (yǒuhuò)
    • pinyin: yǒuhuò
    • definition: in stock; available
    • usage: (of goods) available for immediate sale or use.
    • example: 请问这款手机还有货吗？(qǐngwèn zhè kuǎn shǒujī hái yǒuhuò ma?) - excuse me, is this model of phone still in stock?
    • contexts: shopping, retail, inventory.
  10. 货比三家 (huò bǐ sān jiā)
    • pinyin: huò bǐ sān jiā
    • definition: to shop around; to compare prices/quality before buying (idiom: compare goods at three stores)
    • usage: to visit several stores or check different sources before making a purchase to ensure the best price or quality.
    • example: 买大件商品时最好货比三家。(mǎi dàjiàn shāngpǐn shí zuìhǎo huò bǐ sān jiā.) - it’s best to shop around when buying expensive items.
    • contexts: shopping advice, consumer behavior, bargaining.

day 35

  1. 橱窗 (chúchuāng)
    • pinyin: chúchuāng
    • definition: shop window; display window
    • usage: a window in a shop or store in which goods are displayed.
    • example: 我被橱窗里的那件衣服吸引了。(wǒ bèi chúchuāng lǐ de nà jiàn yīfu xīyǐn le.) - i was attracted by that dress in the shop window.
    • contexts: shopping, retail display, visual merchandising.
  2. 导购员 (dǎogòuyuán)
    • pinyin: dǎogòuyuán
    • definition: shop assistant; sales associate
    • usage: a person whose job is to serve customers in a shop.
    • example: 如果有需要，可以咨询导购员。(rúguǒ yǒu xūyào, kěyǐ zīxún dǎogòuyuán.) - if you need help, you can ask a sales associate.
    • contexts: shopping, customer service, retail.
  3. 推荐 (tuījiàn)
    • pinyin: tuījiàn
    • definition: to recommend; recommendation
    • usage: to suggest or praise (something) as being good or suitable for a particular purpose or role.
    • example: 你有什么好的餐厅推荐吗？(nǐ yǒu shénme hǎo de cāntīng tuījiàn ma?) - do you have any good restaurant recommendations?
    • contexts: shopping, dining, advice, media.
  4. 适合 (shìhé)
    • pinyin: shìhé
    • definition: to suit; to fit
    • usage: right for a particular person, purpose, or situation.
    • example: 这件衣服的颜色很适合你。(zhè jiàn yīfu de yánsè hěn shìhé nǐ.) - the color of this dress suits you very well.
    • contexts: clothing, personal preferences, choices.
  5. 尺寸 (chǐcùn)
    • pinyin: chǐcùn
    • definition: size (of clothes, shoes, etc.); dimension; measurement
    • usage: the relative extent of something; a thing’s overall dimensions or magnitude; how big something is.
    • example: 请问这个有别的尺寸吗？(qǐngwèn zhège yǒu biéde chǐcùn ma?) - excuse me, does this come in other sizes?
    • contexts: clothes shopping, manufacturing, design.
  6. 型号 (xínghào)
    • pinyin: xínghào
    • definition: model (number); type (of product)
    • usage: a particular design or version of a product.
    • example: 这个型号的手机功能更全。(zhège xínghào de shǒujī gōngnéng gèng quán.) - this model of phone has more complete functions.
    • contexts: electronics, appliances, cars, shopping.
  7. 颜色 (yánsè)
    • pinyin: yánsè
    • definition: color
    • usage: the property possessed by an object of producing different sensations on the eye as a result of the way it reflects or emits light.
    • example: 你喜欢什么颜色？(nǐ xǐhuān shénme yánsè?) - what color do you like?
    • contexts: shopping, design, art, description.
  8. 材料 (cáiliào)
    • pinyin: cáiliào
    • definition: material; stuff; data
    • usage: the matter from which a thing is or can be made; facts, information, or ideas for use in creating a book or other work.
    • example: 这件衣服是什么材料做的？(zhè jiàn yīfu shì shénme cáiliào zuò de?) - what material is this clothing made of?
    • contexts: manufacturing, shopping, construction, research.
  9. 包装 (bāozhuāng)
    • pinyin: bāozhuāng
    • definition: packaging; to pack
    • usage: materials used to wrap or protect goods; the action of wrapping something.
    • example: 这个产品的包装很精美。(zhège chǎnpǐn de bāozhuāng hěn jīngměi.) - the packaging of this product is very exquisite.
    • contexts: retail, gifts, logistics, product design.
  10. 逛 (guàng)
    • pinyin: guàng
    • definition: to stroll; to wander; to roam (often in the context of shopping or sightseeing)
    • usage: to walk or travel without a definite purpose or direction, often for pleasure.
    • example: 我们去街上逛逛吧。(wǒmen qù jiē shàng guàngguang ba.) - let’s go stroll around the streets.
    • contexts: leisure, shopping, sightseeing.
